result.execSummary:
The defendant LeSean Z Graves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim, S.C., (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

***AMENDED 7/6/17 TO REFLECT CORRECT VICTIMS INITIALS AS AC***

timeConds.notes: Serve 3 months, balance is stayed.  With Huber for work and school. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.
Defendant is to perform 10 hours of Community Service work per week when not employed and/or in school full time.

Ct 1: 961.41(1m)(h)1-PCS w/INTENT - THC. DEFENDANT HAS POSTED $500.00 ON 01-23-2014 SO HE MUST ONLY POST AN ADDITIONAL $500.00. No contact with codefendant.    It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Sentencing hearing on January 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant LeSean Z Graves in court with attorney Brian P. Dimmer.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Deft did not appear for PSI interview. The Court also indicates that they have an incident report from ZCI showing violations. The State did not receive the most recent ZCI report. The State asks the bond be increased due to the violations and so the PSI writer can do the interview that's necessary. Defense asks bond not be raised. Deft is working and is seeing a therapist.

BTC: DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY. Bond to be modified to $1000.00 cash. Conditions remain as previously ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
